services.name: AI Workshop
services.description:
Future Innovators AI Course: Where Kids Become Tech Creators!

Unlock Your Child’s Potential with AI! Discover the magic behind artificial intelligence in our hands-on, creative AI course. From building chatbots to generating images and exploring ethical AI, kids dive into machine learning, computer vision, and more—all guided by expert instructors. Turn curiosity into real-world skills today!

Why Our AI Course is Different

  • Hands-on learning with cutting-edge technologies
  • Experienced instructors guiding every step
  • Transform curiosity into real-world skills

What Your Child Will Discover

  • The magic behind artificial intelligence
  • How machines learn and think
  • Creative applications across art, language, and technology
services.instructions: Location: 12625 High Bluff Dr #113, San Diego, CA 92130

services.name: Python Workshop
services.description:
The Python Workshop is meant for all new students. This course will introduce you to our Python curriculum.

Students will learn the basics of Python, such as variables (integer, float, boolean, string), basic string I/O, conditional statements (if-elif-else), for loops, while loops, modulo, function calls, function definitions, and simple algorithms. For more information on our Python curriculum, click here.

*If you do not see a time that works for you, please fill out this FORM and a staff member will contact you.
services.instructions:
Welcome...before your first day of class, we have some HOMEWORK for you!

  • Please have your student set up an account on GitHub. This is a TWO STEP PROCESS. First, on the GitHub site create a username and password which can be easily remembered by student. This account will be used to save class work on the first day (and each day thereafter). Second, after the account is created, GitHub will send you a verification email. You will need to open this email and follow the instructions for account verification. GitHub is a site which stores their code in the cloud so students can access it from home. It will enable students to build and organize their professional portfolio of work. Students will also be able to share their projects with you at home!

  • Email: info@jointheleague.org, and include your student’s name and their new GitHub username (you can send the password as well if you think they may forget it).

  • Upload a profile picture for your child. Their photo may be used both internally and on social media in announcements, such as when they level up. Please let us know if you do not want their photo to be used.

  1. Login to the parent portal

  2. On the right side menu under “People you manage” click on your child’s name.

  3. On their right side menu select “Photos”

  4. Click on “New Profile Photo” and upload your child’s photo

We are so excited to get started...can’t wait to see you!

services.name: Java Workshop
services.description:
The Java Workshop teaches new programmers the basics of programming with Java, starting with programs to draw simple graphics, then teaching about logic, functions, loops and variables, and ending with a small programming project.

For beginning programmers from 5th to 12th grade.

Students will learn:

  • Java commands and statements
  • Conditional Logic
  • Variables
  • Functions

services.name: Tech Arcade
services.description:
Tech Arcade covers topics from all of our workshops, including Python, Java, Microcontrollers and AI.

For beginning programmers from 3rd to 12th grade.

services.name: Game Development with Godot
services.description:
Code Your Own Adventure: Game Making for Kids!

Course Overview

Ever wanted to create your own awesome video games? Now you can! Join us online as we dive into Godot, the coolest free game engine that works on any computer. You'll learn to code with GDScript (don't worry, it's super easy!) and discover how to bring your game ideas to life from the comfort of your own home. No coding experience needed—just bring your imagination!

What We'll Build Together!

Week 1: Meet Your New Superpower!

Explore Godot and get ready to become a game creator

Week 2: Make Characters Move and Jump!

Learn the magic behind getting your player to run, jump, and explore

Week 3: Add Bad Guys and Epic Battles!

Create enemies and give your hero cool weapons to fight back

Week 4: Crash, Boom, Level Up!

Make things collide and build multiple levels for epic adventures

Week 5: Make It Look Amazing!

Add awesome graphics, sounds, and menus that look professional

Week 6: Show Off Your Masterpiece!

Put the finishing touches on your game and share it with friends

You'll Become a Game Dev Wizard!

  • Turn your wildest game ideas into reality

  • Learn to code like a pro (but way more fun!)

  • Build characters that jump, run, and fight

  • Create entire worlds for players to explore

  • Design cool graphics and awesome sound effects

  • Have a finished game to show your friends and family

Zero experience required—just bring your creativity and get ready to have a blast!

services.name: Tech Arcade - 3 Day
services.description:
Tech Arcade covers topics from all of our workshops, including Microbit, Python, and MakeCode Arcade (online game-making)

For beginning programmers from 3rd to 12th grade.
